p: Polyphenols are also found modified with other natural synthons. Socolsky et al. [ 55] isolated several unusual terpenylated acylphloroglucinols, wallichin A-D, filixic acids ABA and ABB, and albaspidin AA and AB (Fig. 4), from the rhizomes and scales of the fern Dryopteris wallichiana, traditionally used to treat helminthiases. The authors then evaluated these derivatives in a viability assay against the L4 larval stage of the rat nematode Nippostrongylus brasiliensis. It was found that wallichins A and B as well as flilixic acids displayed higher potency than unmodified polyphenols, with LD 50 = 22–37 µM, while wallichin C and the albaspidins displayed 5-fold weaker activity. The authors hypothesised that a free hydroxy group at the C-4′ position of wallichins A and B was important for modulating activity.
